alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Coffey; Franklin (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 22 at 10:03AM CST until December 23 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST FRIDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, snow with near blizzard conditions expected in falling snow. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills from 25 below zero to 40 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of east central Kansas. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until midnight CST tonight. For the Wind Chill Warning, until noon CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
